content.text: Nuclear power stations generate electricity
Which of these statements describe an advantage of using nuclear power stations, and which of them describe a disadvantage?
Put a tick \((\checkmark)\) in the correct column for each statement. The first one is done for you

table.html:
statementadvantagedisadvantage
nuclear power stations require high levels of security\(\checkmark\)
nuclear power stations produce small amounts of carbon dioxide
nuclear power stations have a small effect on climate change
waste radioactive material can take a very long time to decay

density =   .........  \(g / \text{cm}^3\)

weight =   .........  N

State the name of the type of energy gained by the cabin as it rises

The cabin is released and swings down between the two pylons. The path of the cabin is shown on Fig. 4.1. The cabin has maximum kinetic energy at one point on its path. Draw this point on Fig. 4.1 and label this point X
A force opposes the motion of the cabin as it falls. State the name of this force
After a few swings, a brake system stops the cabin (not shown on the diagram)
Use ideas about energy transfer to suggest how the brake system stops the cabin
Fig. 4.1 shows a fairground ride
People sit inside a cabin suspended between two pylons. The cabin is lifted to the starting position shown in Fig. 4.1
State the term given to materials that reduce the transfer of thermal energy
The hot drink gradually cools
Describe and explain **two** processes by which thermal energy is transferred from the hot drink
A cup made from plastic, containing a hot drink, is shown in Fig. 5.1

* mark the angle of reflection at Q using the letter \(r\),

parallel to the incident ray at P,
perpendicular to the incident ray at P,

communications,

An atom of carbon contains protons, neutrons and electrons
Indicate where each particle is found in the atom. Place a tick in the appropriate box
State the proton number of the carbon
State the nucleon number of the carbon
An atom of carbon contains 6 protons, 7 neutrons and 6 electrons
Explain the meaning of the term isotope
The nuclide notation for the carbon in (b) is \(^{13}_{6}\mathrm{C}\)
Suggest the nuclide notation for another possible isotope of carbon
Carbon has many different isotopes

Some metals can be used to make permanent magnets

observers see
observers hear
